prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. These are very specific steps and we are looking for very specific responses, not general cyber security advice.I will walk you through my discoveries step-by-step in the following messages.

summary: {"Locator": "ZBA8RF","Summary": "This ticket, with the locator ZBA8RF, pertains to a WAZUH Alert Analysis and Response. The alert refers to a potential incident of unmanaged PowerShell execution, a sign of possible unauthorized or malicious activity. The incident was associated with Agent 056 - DC, triggering a rule ID 92151 aligned with MITRE ID T1059.001. Immediate actions were required and steps were taken to verify the authenticity of the PowerShell execution, review the PowerShell scripts, terminate unauthorized scripts, and conduct an investigation into the origin of the script. Firewall rules were changed to block the suspected attacker. The ticket's status is now 'Closed' and its severity leveled at 'Medium'.","Assignee": "N/A","Last_Action": "Changed status to Closed"}

prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. These are very specific steps and we are looking for very specific responses, not general cyber security advice.I will walk you through my discoveries step-by-step in the following messages.
summary: {"Locator": "BPX753","Summary": "This ticket indicates that a rule has been created to monitor an event where a PowerShell script has used the \"Invoke-command\" cmdlet to execute a sub-script. It was marked as an 'Alert' with a high severity level of 5, which was later changed to 'Low'.","Assignee": "Unassigned","Last Action": "A change in alert severity from high to low","Next Suggested Action": "Based on the invocation of PowerShell scripts (MITRE ATT&CK ID: T1059.001), the next action should be to identify the source of this PowerShell command execution. Search for logs relating to PowerShell usage, review these logs to see if there are any unexpected or malicious commands being run. If possible, trace the origin of the script to see if it leads back to a particular user or system. Assign this ticket to a member of the incident response team for immediate investigation as these could potentially be indicators of a system breach or an ongoing attack."}

prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. If possible, restore the deleted script from backup or shadow copies for malware analysis. Update the incident ticket with findings and record observables for further threat hunting activities."}

Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. These are very specific steps and we are looking for very specific responses, not general cyber security advice.I will walk you through my discoveries step-by-step in the following messages.
summary: {"Locator": "AHMGMQ","Summary": "This ticket is about a suspicious script creation on a Windows Server 2022. The severity of the issue has been changed multiple times, and the case is currently in the triage stage. The source of the issue is being investigated on 192.168.127.160 Windows-Server-2022. A file named 'umkwwtl4.dll' in the Temp folder was mentioned but is no longer available.","Assignee": "e4_blue-06","Last Action": "Possible continued investigation by Blue 05","Next Suggested Action": "The next step should be to perform a thorough investigation of the Windows Server 2022 system logs for any unusual activity. This could include failed login attempts, changes in user privileges, or the creation of new accounts. The server should also be scanned for any other suspicious files or scripts. If the 'umkwwtl4.dll' file was malicious, it's possible that other malicious files are present. The investigation should also extend to any other systems that interact with the affected server. This aligns with MITRE ATT&CK ID T1082 (System Information Discovery) and T1005 (Data from Local System)."}

The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. These are very specific steps and we are looking for very specific responses, not general cyber security advice.I will walk you through my discoveries step-by-step in the following messages.
summary: {"Locator": "Z10B4C","Summary": "This ticket is about an established OpenVPN remote connection from the source IP address 10.192.83.198. The severity of the incident has been set to high and the status is currently in triage. The case has been assigned to E4_blue-04 for further investigation.","Assignee": "E4_blue-04","Last Action": "OpenVPN remote connection established from IP 10.192.83.198. The case is currently under investigation.","Next Suggested Action": "The next step should be to identify the user associated with the IP address 10.192.83.198 and check the VPN logs for any unusual activity. If the user is not recognized, the connection should be terminated immediately. The system should also be checked for any changes or anomalies that could indicate malicious activity. This aligns with MITRE ATT&CK's T1078 (Valid Accounts) and T1040 (Network Sniffing)."}

prompt_prefix: I am a cyber security incident responder working in a simulated cyber security incident response scenario.I am going to share with you my observations while I am responding a potential intrusion.For now, I just want you to read these instructions and then later on I will explain how I would like you to reply. Do not start responding until I tell you to. The simulation environment is for a fictitious port authority.  The port system comprises various IT and OT components which are vital for ports operations.The port is a 20km long channel that accommodates unidirectional vessel traffic.Coordinating smooth vessel operations involves integrating information from IoT depth sensors, to manage traffic the port.This depth sensor system measures tide values, all throughout the channel.This information is then used by multiple port business entities and stakeholders to carry out their operations.  Tide information is provided to following business entities/stakeholders:  - Centralised Web System showing current and forecast tide values within the channel to the harbor master, ship captains and other various business stakeholders.  - Port Authority VSTS-CR.  - Tugboat pilots get tide values for safe navigation towards port births.  - Shipping Companies get data from Weather Central Website which ingests IoT Streams.  - Dynamic Under kneel Clearance (DUKC) system needs accurate tide values to produce correct  - simulations required for optimised vessels operations within channel.  The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.   I am going to give you single steps from the simulated incident.I want you to give me very specific advice on what steps I could take next to identify and contain the attack.In your response, please reference the MITRE Attack and MITRE defend IDs if relevant. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations. Reviewing the firewall logs for any additional attempts or patterns from the source IP (MITRE ATT&CK: T1018 - Remote System Discovery). 2. Analyzing the destination system's logs around the time of the attempt to check for any successful connections or anomalies (MITRE ATT&CK: T1016 - System Network Configuration Discovery). 3. Increasing monitoring on the source and destination IP addresses to detect further suspicious activities (MITRE DEFEND: D3 - Develop and Implement Network Perimeter Defenses). 4. Verifying the security configurations of the destination host, especially services running on port 8383 (MITRE DEFEND: D1 - Develop and Implement Secure Network Infrastructure). 5. Conducting a network sweep to ensure no other systems are compromised or exhibiting similar signs of an attack (MITRE ATT&CK: T1046 - Network Service Scanning)."}

The attacker is objective is to disrupt port channel vessel operations by attacking the underlying IoT Depth Sensors system, which could result in safety hazards, loss of revenue, and damage to the reputation of the Port Authority.  - Attacking the IT/OT/IoT systems that guide vessels through the channel could result in blocking the channel for an extended period due to a grounded or sunk vessel.  - Disruptions in scheduled operations, particularly inbound and outbound vessel operations, could occur, causing delays and potential financial losses.  - The impact of the attack could also cause delays in mooring and birth, which could indirectly affect loading and unloading operations, impacting inland operations.
